thread.title: Paris Saint-Germain not interested in summer move for Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero
thread.title_full: Paris Saint-Germain not interested in summer move for Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero

author: James Robson
title: Paris Saint-Germain not interested in summer move for Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero
text:
Aguero's future is not certain (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
French champions Paris Saint-Germain have no interest in Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero. 
Aguero has been linked with a move to the big-spending Ligue 1 side in the summer, after being dropped by Pep Guardiola, reports the Manchester Evening News. 
The Qatari-owned club could afford the financial package necessary to land the Argentine international hitman. 
But with Uruguayan striker Edinson Cavani already at the Parc des Princes, PSG will instead target more versatile cover for their first choice centre forward. Aguero was only a substitute at the weekend (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Cavani is the No.1 striker in Paris (Photo: AFP) Read More Man City ready to unleash Aguero and Gabriel Jesus on Bournemouth TOGETHER 
Their preference is to find a player capable of operating on the wing, as well as leading the line. 
Aguero’s future has been thrown into doubt after being displaced by Gabriel Jesus in Guardiola’s team. 
City insist they do not want to sell their leading scorer - while the 28-year-old is adamant he will fight for his place. 
But Jesus’ stunning start following his move from Palmeiras last month has presented the biggest threat to Aguero’s place since he arrived at the club in 2011. Gabriel Jesus scores his second against the Swans (Photo: PA) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
